definition: strike or hit heavily and repeatedly
example: Pounding on the door, she shouted at the top of her voice.

definition: (of behaviour or actions) not proper or appropriate
example: He spent unseemly amounts of money on himself.

definition: contrary to reason or common sense; utterly absurd or ridiculous
example: It was a preposterous idea, and no one took it seriously.

definition: an unfair or resented demand or burden
example: Your kids can stay with me the night you're away—it's really not an imposition.

definition: wild or distraught with fear, anxiety, or other emotion
example: She was frantic with worry.

definition: anticipate with great apprehension or fear
example: Jane was dreading the party.

definition: not dependent on the mind for existence; actual / something that you are trying to achieve
example: The main objective of this meeting is to give more information on our plans.

definition: consider one thing to be the same as or equivalent to another
example: Some parents equate education with exam success.

definition: to measure precisely
example: She carefully calibrated the dosage of a medicine.

definition: climb up a rising surface
example: He mounted the stairs.

definition: go up or climb
example: She ascended the stairs.

definition: bring together a group of people for a meeting
example: The prime minister convened his cabinet to discuss the matter.

definition: search for mineral deposits; possibility that something will happen; future outlook
example: There is no immediate prospect of peace.

definition: to grow or appear suddenly
example: New towns are springing up to house the increasing population.

definition: obtain a substance from something by a special method
example: Lead was extracted from the copper.

definition: a small rocky body orbiting the sun
example: Asteroids are numerous in outer space.

definition: relating to the sky or outer space
example: The moon is a celestial body.

definition: cause someone to feel embarrassed or humiliated
example: She was mortified to see her wrinkles in the mirror.

definition: move about in search of prey
example: Black bears prowl the canyons.

definition: sleep or lie dormant
example: Sleeping Beauty slumbered in her forest castle.

definition: feel angry or resentful toward someone
example: I don't grudge her the opportunities she has been given.

definition: the intention or desire to do evil
example: I bear no malice towards anybody.

meaning_cn: 沉闷枯燥的；令人沮丧的
definition: dull, bleak, and depressing
example: I hate the dreary round of working and sleeping.

definition: accept or support willingly
example: Much of the population quickly embraced Islam.

definition: very skilled at something
example: He was adept at using computers.

definition: move with a smooth wave-like motion
example: Her body undulated to the rhythm of the music.

definition: decorated with complex patterns
example: She doesn't like ornate jewelry.

definition: serious and unrelenting
example: A smile transformed his stern face.

definition: praise highly
example: The essay exalts the beauty of the countryside.

definition: stop or slow the progress of something undesirable
example: Efforts were made to check the disease.

definition: produce tears, blood, or lose leaves
example: The trees shed their leaves in autumn.

definition: make an exact copy
example: It might be impractical to replicate Eastern culture in the west.

definition: move continuously through a system
example: The fan circulates hot air around the oven.

definition: more than enough
example: There is ample time for discussion.

definition: a person who supports an idea
example: She is a leading exponent of the theory.

definition: increasing very rapidly
example: There has been an exponential increase in population.

definition: surround a place to capture it
example: The town was besieged for two months.

definition: grand and impressive
example: He is an imposing man.

definition: make lively or excited
example: A smile animated his face.

definition: rest on a high place
example: A bird perched on the branch.

definition: a substance used to kill insects
example: Many pests are resistant to the insecticide.

definition: occurring at irregular intervals
example: She made intermittent appearances.

definition: existing as a permanent quality
example: Mountaineering has inherent dangers.

definition: weaken principles or put at risk
example: Don't compromise your principles.
